text: [Music]
has now been on the run for more than
two days causing havoc across Meerut
this leopard seemed briefly here on
camera has forced schools to close as
police searched the city streets the
leopard went on the run at around
midnight on Sunday Amir at around 70
kilometers east of Delhi for some time
it was stuck in a room at a local
hospital but managed to escape the most
recent sighting was in the Abilene area
of the city police armed with
tranquilizer darts have been searching
for the animal that's already injured
six people even soldiers have joined the
hunt but one point officials managed to
back the leopard into a warehouse but
just as it did before at the hospital it
went on to escape humanity is
encroaching on the habitats of a lot of
the wildlife like leopards and lions and
tigers and thus far little far far less
space for them to actually live so
they're bound to actually interact a lot
more with with people by coming to
villages and coming into towns and a
mirror to the effects of that
interaction are clear residents just
hope the leopard will be caught soon so
the city can return to some normality
Rebecca Williams BBC news
